prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.1071, 0.0804, 0.0] Now, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Draw a rectangle using four lines as follows: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.1607], End Point [0.0536, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.0536, 0.0], End Point [0.4821, 0.0] - Line 3: Start Point [0.4821, 0.0], End Point [0.5357, 0.1607] - Line 4: Start Point [0.5357, 0.1607], End Point [0.0, 0.1607] Close the loop to form a face. Scale the sketch by 0.5357. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0402 units in both directions to generate the 3D model. **Part 2: Construct a rectangular prism with a curved side.** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.375, 0.0078, 0.0788] Create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. Draw a rectangle and a circle using lines and arcs as follows: - Rectangle: Start Point [0.0, 0.0651], End Point [0.0327, 0.0], Start Point [0.0327, 0.0], End Point [0.0469, 0.0077], Start Point [0.0469, 0.0077], End Point [0.0141, 0.0727], Start Point [0.0141, 0.0727], End Point [0.0, 0.0651] - Circle: Start Point [0.0977, 0.0074], End Point [0.112, 0.0002], Center Point [0.1048, 0.0038], Radius = (0.0141-0.0037)/2 Close the loop to form a face. Scale the sketch by 0.1448. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch along the Z-axis by 0.1366 units in both directions to generate the 3D model, joining it to the previous part. The final assembly will be a rectangular prism with a cylindrical base, a rectangular top, and a flat surface on one side.</description>
